article.headline: American 74, Lafayette 56
article.story: MURFREESBORO, Tenn. (AP) -- Middle Tennessee cruised to a 73-59 win over Louisiana-Lafayette on Saturday behind 21 points from Adam Vogelsberg. Middle Tennessee (10-9, 3-4 Sunbelt) scored 30 points off turnovers by Louisiana-Lafayette (5-14, 1-7). The game was tight in the first half, which ended with Middle Tennessee ahead 25-24. The score was tied seven times and there were nine lead changes. The Blue Raiders outscored the Cajuns by 13 in the second half, led by Vogelsberg. Tim Blue scored 14 points for Middle Tennessee, while Fats Cuyler finished with 13 and Matt Morrison had 11. Louisiana-Lafayette had three players who scored in double digits, led by Lucian Pesoli's 13. Maurice Barksdale and Michael Southall scored 12 apiece for the Cajuns.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
